chapter.title: Stream from an MPEG encoding card

note.para: This is possible under Linux only.

chapter.para: VideoLAN supports two MPEG-2 encoding cards :
The Hauppauge WinTV-PVR-250 gives much better results and is cheaper than the Visiontech Kfir.

sect1.title: Stream with the Hauppauge WinTV-PVR-250 card

sect2.title: Install the drivers
sect2.para: First, you will have to patch your kernel to support the v4l2 API (Video 4 Linux version 2). The patch is available on the Video4Linux HQ.

Once your kernel is ready, install the CVS version of the Linux drivers of the Hauppauge WinTV-PVR-250. They are hosted on ivtv.sourceforge.net. Then, you will have to create the device, load the modules and setup the card with the ptune.pl and test_ioctl programs. Please, refer to the documentation that come with the drivers.

note.para: You should use the CVS version of VLC and you must add --enable-pvr to ./configure to use this feature. You may want to change the value of CR_MAX_AVERAGE_COUNTER to 1000 in src/input/input_clock.c to work around a problem with the card.

listitem.para: /dev/video0 is the device corresponding to the encoding card,
norm=secam is name of the standard of the analogic signal (secam, pal and ntsc are the possible values),
size=720x576is the size of the video you want to stream,
frequency=567250 is the frequency in kHz of the channel you want to stream,
bitrate=3000000 is the average bitrate of the stream,
maxbitrate=4000000 is the maximum bitrate of the stream,
the IP address of the machine you want to unicast to ;
or the DNS name the machine you want to unicast to ;
12 is the value of the TTL (Time To Live) of your IP packets (which means that the stream will be able to cross 11 routers).

sect2.title: Stream with VLS
sect2.para: There is no command line interface for this input for the moment, so you will have to use the configuration file.
Here is a typical configuration file vls.cfg to run VLS with a Hauppauge WinTV-PVR-250 encoding card:
sect2.programlisting:
# vls.cfg (VLS configuration file) # Example of the VideoLAN HOWTO for the Hauppauge WinTV-PVR-250 encoding card
BEGIN "Inputs"
pvr = "video"
END
BEGIN "pvr"
# Hauppauge WinTV-PVR-250 device Device = "/dev/video0"
# Stream type Type = "Mpeg2-PS"
END
BEGIN "Channels"
channel1 = "network"
END
BEGIN "channel1"
# Unicast or multicast IP address DstHost = "192.168.0.42"
# Destination port DstPort = "1234"
# If it's a multicast IP address, uncomment the line below #Type = "multicast"
# If it's a multicast IP address, set the "Time To Live" below #TTL = "12"
END
BEGIN "LaunchOnStartUp"
command1 = "start video channel1 pvr"
END

sect1.title: Stream with the Visiontech Kfir card

sect2.title: Install the drivers
sect2.para: If you want to be able to stream from a Visiontech Kfir card, you need to install its Linux drivers. Download the latest release of the drivers from the drivers download page of the LinuxTV web site.
Uncompress the tarball and follow the instructions written in the README file to compile and install the drivers.

note.para: If you have a VIA chipset, you need to disable USB in the BIOS.

listitem.para: /dev/video is the device corresponding to the Kfir card,
the IP address of the machine you want to unicast to ;
or the DNS name the machine you want to unicast to ;
12 is the value of the TTL (Time To Live) of your IP packets (which means that the stream will be able to cross 11 routers).

sect2.title: Stream with VLS
sect2.para: There is no command line interface for this input for the moment, so you will have to use the configuration file.
Here is a typical configuration file vls.cfg to run VLS with a Visiontech Kfir encoding card:
sect2.programlisting:
# vls.cfg (VLS configuration file) # Example of the VideoLAN HOWTO for the Visiontech Kfir encoding card
BEGIN "Inputs"
kfir = "video"
END
BEGIN "kfir"
# Visiontech Kfir device Device = "/dev/video"
# Stream type (default is "Mpeg2-PS") Type = "Mpeg2-PS"
END
BEGIN "Channels"
channel1 = "network"
END
BEGIN "channel1"
# Unicast or multicast IP address DstHost = "192.168.0.42"
# Destination port DstPort = "1234"
# If it's a multicast IP address, uncomment the line below #Type = "multicast"
# If it's a multicast IP address, set the "Time To Live" below #TTL = "12"
END
BEGIN "LaunchOnStartUp"
command1 = "start video channel1 kfir"
END
